pupa kik Pupa; pupal. Eng. See moeapupa.

pupē kik Puffin. Eng. Also manu pupē.

pū pihi kik Trumpet. Lit., horn (with) buttons. See pū koa. Pū pihi poko. Cornet.

pupū ʻaʻ To be hung, as a network system in a computer program. Ke pupū maila ka ʻōnaehana pūnaewele. The network system is hung. Dic., ext. mng.

pū puhi uai kik Trombone. Lit., sliding horn.

pū puhi Palani kik French horn.

pū·ʻali hoʻo·uka kaua kik Marine corps. Lit., army (for) attacking.

pū·ʻali kaua lewa kik Air force. Lit., sky-war army.

pū·ʻali kaua moana kik Navy. Lit., ocean-war army. Also ʻau moku kaua, ʻoihana moku. Kahua pūʻali kaua moana. Navy base.

pū·ʻali kiaʻi mō·ʻī kik King's guard. Lit., soldiers (for) guarding kings.

pū·ʻali koa kik Army; military service. Mān. Kahua pūʻali koa. Military base.

pū·ʻali koa kū·ika·wā kik Militia. Trad.

pū·ʻali nō·iki kik Alveolar duct, in anatomy. Lit., alveolus isthmus.

pū·ʻali pale kapa kai kik Coast guard. Lit., coast guard army.

pū·ʻolo kik Bag; twelve-pack, as of drinks. Niʻihau. Cf. ʻope. See entries below and pahu, ʻeke, ʻekeʻeke. Pūʻolo koloaka. Twelve-pack of soda. Pūʻolo pia. Twelve-pack of beer.

pū·ʻolo koho·koho kik Guessing bag.

pū·ʻolo pepa kik Paper bag. Cf. ʻeke ʻea.

pū·ʻoʻa uahi kik Smokestack, as for a factory. Lit., smoke tower.

pū ʻoʻohe kik Any woodwind instrument. Comb. pū + redup. of ʻohe.

puʻu kik Throat. Dic. See entries below.

puʻu kik Cone, a geological feature. Dic. Puʻu ahupapa. Composite cone. Puʻu hakuhune. Tuff cone. Puʻu kuahene. Shield cone. Puʻu lehu. Ash cone. Pūʻu ʻākeke. Cinder cone.

pū·ʻuo kik Population, as in biology. Sh. pūʻulu + ʻuo. Ili pūʻuo. Population distribution, in geography. Also ili pūʻuo kanaka. Paʻapū pūʻuo kanaka. Population density, for humans only.

pū·ʻuo·ʻuo kik/ʻaʻ Cohesion; cohesive. Comb. pū + ʻuoʻuo. Cf. pīlekaleka.

puʻu haʻa·pupu kik Speed bump, as on a road or in a parking lot. Lit., bump (for) holding back.

puʻu·kani kik Singer. Dic.

pū·ʻulu kik Group. Dic. See hoʻopū- ʻulu, kūkā ma ka pūʻulu. Pūʻulu meaʻai. Food group, i.e. one of the six food groups, in nutrition. Pae pūʻulu meaʻai. The food groups, i.e. the collective union of all six food groups (calcium/milk, vegetable, fruit, starch, meat, and fat).

 

 

puʻu·naue ham Division; to divide, in math. Dic. See entries below. Kaha puʻunaue. Division sign. Kumu puʻunaue. Dividend.

puʻu·naue koena ʻole ham Divisible, in math. Lit., division without remainder.

puʻu·naue lua ham Composite, in math. Lit., double division. Helu puʻunaue lua. Composite number.

puʻu neʻena hau kik Moraine. Lit., hill (caused by) movement (of) ice.

puʻu pele kik Volcanic cone, in geology.

puʻu pō·hā·hā kik Spatter cone, in geology. Lit., ejecta cone.

puʻu·puʻu kik Nodule, as on a leguminous plant. Dic., ext. mng. See entries below.

puʻu·puʻu Hānai puʻupuʻu. To serve underhand, in volleyball. Kuʻi puʻupuʻu. To spike with closed fist.

puʻu·puʻu moa kik Chicken pox. Niʻihau.

puʻu·wai See hoʻoikaika puʻuwai, koʻe puʻuwai. Pona puʻuwai. Atrium, of the mammalian heart. Also pona. Pona puʻuwai hema. Left atrium. Also pona hema. Pona puʻuwai ʻākau. Right atrium. Also pona ʻākau. ʻŌpū puʻuwai. Ventricle, of the mammalian heart. Also ʻōpū. ʻŌpū puʻuwai hema. Left ventricle. Also ʻōpū hema. ʻŌpū puʻuwai ʻākau. Right ventricle. Also ʻōpū ʻākau.

puʻu·wai pana ʻewa·ʻewa kik Cardiac arrythmia. Lit., heart (with) irregular beat.

Puruma iʻoa Burma; Burmese. Eng. Also Buruma.

pū·tē heh To scowl. Ua pūtē maila ʻo Pāpā iaʻu i koʻu hoʻi lohi ʻana mai i ka hale. Daddy scowled at me when I came home late. Niʻihau. Cf. hoʻokuʻemaka.

ph Abbreviation for pāhaneli (hecto-).

Ph Abbreviation for Palanaheika (Fahrenheit).

phk Abbreviation for pihanahaka (volume).

pk Abbreviation for pākaukani (kilo-).

PK Abbreviation for ʻai pākaukani (kilobyte).

pkl Abbreviation for pākiliona (tera-).

pl Abbreviation for pule (week).

PLH Abbreviation for Papa Lawelawe Hoʻolaha (Bulletin Board Service).

pll Abbreviation for palela (barrel).

pm Abbreviation for pāmiliona (mega-).

p.m. Post meridium, p.m. (pronounced pīmū). Eng. See a.m.

PM Abbreviation for ʻai pāmiliona (megabyte).

p/min Abbreviation for puni o ka minuke (revolutions per minute).

pp Abbreviation for pāpiliona (giga-).

PP Abbreviation for ʻai pāpiliona (gigabyte).

PʻĀH Abbreviation for palena ʻāluna o ka hewa (greatest possible error).

pʻm Abbreviation for pāʻumi (deka-).

W

wā kik Fret, as on an ʻukulele, guitar, etc. Dic. See ʻukulele.

wā kik Interval, i.e. the number of units between spaces on a graph's scale, in math. Dic., ext. mng.

wae·leʻa ham To distinguish. Comb. wae + leʻa (clearly, thoroughly).

wae moho ham Primary, primary election, i.e. a preliminary election to nominate candidates for office. Ma ka wae moho, e koho kekahi ʻaoʻao kālaiʻāina i ka mea a lākou e kākoʻo ai i ka holo moho ʻana no kekahi kūlana koʻikoʻi o ke aupuni. In the primary, a political party chooses the person they will support in running for election for an important government position. Sh. koho wae moho (dic.). Also koho

 

pāloka wae moho. Wae moho kūākea. Open primary. Wae moho kūloko. Closed primary.

waena Manamana waena. Middle finger. Niʻihau. Also manamana loa.

waena alelo kik Central portion of the tongue. Lit., tongue center. See kūʻau alelo, lau alelo, mole alelo, wēlau alelo.

waena honua Ke Kai Waena Honua. Mediterranean Sea. Pōʻai waena honua. Equator. Also Kapikoowākea.

waena moana Asea, at sea; midocean. Aia nā moku a pau ōna i waena moana. All his ships are at sea. Trad. Kualapa waena moana. Midocean ridge.

wae·waele ham To thin, as plants when gardening. Comb. wae + waele.

wae·ʻano ham To classify, categorize. Lit., sort (by) types.

wae ʻano See pēmāʻōʻā wae ʻano.

wai kik Water. Dic. See entries below and ana kaumaha wai, pena kuapapa wai, pena wai. Nele wai. Anhydrous, i.e. without water. Cf. ʻanahaidaraside. Papa kānāwai wai o ka mokuʻāina. State water code. ʻĀina kumu wai. Watershed, i.e. an area from which water drains.

wai·apuni kik Hydrosphere. Comb. wai + a + puni.

wai·ehu kik File, the tool. Dic. Cf. apuapu. Waiehu makaliʻi. Fine-cut file.

waio·leka niho·ʻī·lio kik Dog's tooth violet, a kind of flower. Comb. Eng. + niho + ʻīlio.

wai·olina kik Violin, fiddle. Dic.

Waio·mina iʻoa Wyoming; Wyomingite. Dic.

wai·ū kik Milk. Dic. See entries below and pahu waiū, ʻōmole omo waiū. Kokoleka me ka waiū huʻahuʻa. Chocolate with frothed milk. Kokoleka me ka waiū māhu. Chocolate with steamed milk.

wai ua kik Rain water.

wai·ū ehu kik Powdered milk. Niʻihau. Also waiū pauka.

wai·ū·haku·haku kik Cottage cheese. Dic.

wai·ū heʻe kik Skim milk. See heʻe.

wai·ū luli·luli kik Milk shake. Dic.

wai·ū pauka kik Powdered milk. Also waiū ehu.

wai·ū·paʻa kik Cheese. Dic. Waiūpaʻa keka. Cheddar cheese. Waiūpaʻa Kuikilani. Swiss cheese.

wai·ū piha kik Whole milk. Lit., complete milk.

wai·ū·tepe kik Yogurt. Comb. waiū + tepe (Māori, congealed).

wai hā·lana kik Flood. Dic. Kāohi wai hālana. Flood control. Kūkala makaʻala wai hālana. Flood watch. Kūkala pōʻino wai hālana. Flood warning.

wai hā·loʻa·loʻa kik Rapids, as in a river. Lit., turbulent water.

waiho ham To file, as files in a file cabinet. Dic., ext. mng. Also hoʻokomo. See entries below.

waiho ham To leave as is, no change, as in a computer program. Dic., ext. mng. Kaha waiho. A series of dots written under a word or words which have been lined out to show that no change should be made from the original, in proof-reading; stet.

waiho kik Spread, as data on a graph, in math. Dic., ext. mng. Ka waiho o ka ʻikepili. Data spread.

waiho inoa See hāpai inoa.

wai·hona kik File, as in a computer program. Dic., ext. mng. Cf. wahī. See entries below and papa kuhi waihona, poʻo pāʻālua. Hulu waihona. File format. Loulou waihona. File link. Peleleu waihona. File extension. Waihona mahola. Expanded file. Waihona papaʻa. Backup file.

 

wai·hona kik Account, as in a bank. Dic., ext. mng. Waihona kālā. Bank account. Waihona hoʻāhu kālā, Savings account. Waihona hoʻolilo. Expense account. Waihona kīkoʻo. Checking account. Waihona kāki. Charge account, credit account.

wai·hona ō kik Endowment fund. Lit., fund (which) endures. Also waihona kālā kūmau.

wai·hona hoʻāhu kik Storage cabinet. Cf. lumi hoʻāhu.

wai·hona kā·lā kū·mau kik Endowment fund. Sh. waihona + puʻu kālā kūmau. Also waihona ō.

wai·hona lā·ʻau lapa·ʻau kik Medicine cabinet. Lit., cabinet (for) medicine.

wai·hona mea pā·ʻani kik Toy chest, toy box. Lit., receptacle (for) toys. Also pahu mea pāʻani.

wai·hona pāiki kik Locker. Lit., satchel cabinet. Also pahu laka.

wai·hona pepa kik File cabinet. Lit., receptacle (for) paper. Also pahu waihona, pahu waihona pepa.

wai·hona wai·wai See pahu waihona waiwai.

wai·hona ʻike kik Memory, as in a computer program. ʻEhia ka nui o ka waihona ʻike kaʻawale o kēia kamepiula? How much available memory is there on this computer? Lit., knowledge repository. Waihona ʻike paʻaloko. Built-in memory. Waihona ʻike keu. Extended memory. Waihona ʻike māhuahua. Expanded memory.

wai honua kik Groundwater. Lit., earth water.

wai·hoʻo·luʻu hui kea kik Additive color, i.e. one of the primary colors (red, blue, green) which, when added together, produce white light. Lit., color (which) combines white.

wai kai kik Salty water. Dic. See wai paʻakai paʻapūhia. Hoʻomānalo wai kai. To desalinate/desalinize salty water.

wai kahe See uila wai kahe.

wai kō·ī kik Cataract, i.e. steep rapids in a large river. Lit., water flowing with force.

wai koko kik Plasma. Lit., blood fluid. Also palasema.

wai kō·ʻie·ʻie kik Run, as in a stream. Lit., rushing water.

wai·lele Kiʻo wai wailele. Plunge pool, i.e. the pool at the base of a waterfall.

wai·lelele kik Cascade. Redup. of wailele.

wai lemi kik Lemonade. Dic.

wai·nola kik Vinyl. Eng.

wai paipu kik Tap water. Lit., pipe water. Wai wela paipu. Hot tap water.

wai paʻa·kai paʻa·pū·hia kik Brine, i.e. a concentrated solution of salt or ocean water. Lit., concentrated salt water. Also wai paʻakai. See hoʻomānalo wai kai.

wai·pele·kī kik Geyser. Comb. wai + pele + kī

wai piʻi·piʻi kik Mineral or sparkling water. Dic., ext. mng.

wai pua kik Nectar, i.e. sweet liquid secreted by the nectaries of a plant. Lit., flower liquid.

wai·wai kik Value. Ua like ka waiwai o kēia ʻōkeni me ka ʻelima kēneka. The value of this coin is five cents. Dic. Waiwai kūʻai. Market value. See entries below and hokona, hoʻomohala waiwai, kālaihoʻokele waiwai. Waiwai kūʻike. Face value. Waiwai wānana. Expected value. Waiwai ʻiʻo. Absolute value. Waiwai ʻaiaola. Nutritive value.

wai·wai Hoʻokele waiwai. Economy. Moʻokūlana waiwai. Balance sheet, i.e. a listing of assets, liabilities, and owner's equity.

wai·wai helu kik Numerical value, in math. Lit., number value.

 

wai·wai kū lana·kila Hoʻokele waiwai kū lanakila. Free-market economy, i.e. the economy of a country wherein buying and selling can take place without government restrictions.

wai·wai mana kahi Hoʻokele waiwai mana kahi. Command economy, i.e. an economic system in which the government controls the factors of production and makes the basic economic decisions.

wai wili·au kik Side pool, as in a stream. Lit., pool (that) moves in eddies.

wai ʻili honua kik Surface water. Lit., earth-surface water. Also wai ʻili.

wai ʻula Pani wai ʻula. Tampon (preceded by ke).

wai ʻume·lau·oho kik Capillary water.

wā o ke kō·kua hua mele kik Space between horizontal lines on a musical staff. Lit., space of the musical staff. Also wā o ke kōkua. Cf. laina o ke kōkua hua mele.

wao kua·hiwi kik Montane area. Lit., mountain region. See wao kumu kuahiwi. Wao kuahiwi haʻahaʻa. Lower montane area. Wao kuahiwi kiʻekiʻe. Upper montane area.

wao kumu kua·hiwi kik Vegetation area at the base of a mountain. Lit., region (at) base (of) mountain. See wao kuahiwi.

wao laʻa·lā·ʻau kik Alpine shrubland. Lit., shrub region.

waha wali kik Smooth talk, smooth talker; to talk smooth; glib. Ma muli o ka maikaʻi loa o kō kēlā kanaka kūʻai kaʻa me ka waha wali, nui ka poʻe kūʻai kaʻa maiā ia mai. Because that car salesman is such a smooth talker, many people buy cars from him. Niʻihau.

wahi kik Region, a specific area, in math. Dic., ext. mng.

wahī kik Folder, as in a computer program. Pono e hana kope ʻia kēlā waihona ma ka wahī ʻōnaehana. That file needs to be copied to the system folder. Dic., ext. mng. Cf. waihona. See entries below. Wahī o waho. External folder.

wā·hia ʻaʻ Decomposed, i.e. broken down into component parts, as through chemical reaction. Dic., ext. mng. Cf. hāpopopo.

wahī iwi Niniki wahī iwi. Periosteum, i.e. the tough membrane adhering tightly to a bone.

wahi hoʻo·malu kik Shelter. Dic.

wahī mimiki kik/ham Shrink-wrapping; to shrink-wrap. Lit., wrapping (that) shrinks.

wahine Hoʻokae wahine. Misogyny, hatred of women. See hoʻokae.

wahi noho kik Residence. Dic. Also hale noho.

wahī pā·leo kik Record album cover. Lit., record album wrapper.

wahī ʻano·ʻano kik Seed pod. Lit., seed case.

wahī ʻea kik Any plastic film for wrapping food, as Saran Wrap. Lit., plastic wrapper.

wahī·ʻeha kik Band aid. Dic., ext. mng.

waho loa Hōkūhele o waho loa. Outer planet.

wā hoʻo·hana kik Session, i.e. a period of time spent in an application of a computer program. Lit., using time.

wā hoʻo·malu kik Probation, in law. ʻO ka ʻōlelo hoʻopaʻi nōna, he ʻeono māhina ma ka wā hoʻomalu. His sentence was six months probation. Lit., time (of) probation. Luna wā hoʻomalu. Probation officer.

Wā·kea See Hoʻohokuikalani.

wā·kiuma kik/ham Vacuum; to vacuum. Dic.

 

Wakine·kona iʻoa Washington; Washingtonian. Dic.

wale ʻili kik Cambium, i.e. the slippery layer under the bark of a plant which is the growing area of the stem. Lit., bark slime.

wali Waha wali. Smooth talk, smooth talker; to talk smooth; glib.

walu ham To scratch with claws, as a cat. Dic. Cf. waʻu.

wā·nana kik/ham Prediction; to predict, as in a scientific experiment. Dic., ext. mng. See waiwai wānana. Mākau wānana. Prediction skill.

wana·ʻā kik Laser. Comb. wana + ʻā. Kukuna wanaʻā. Laser beam.

waniki kik Lacquer. Dic., ext. mng.

wani·lina kik Vanilin, a crystalline solid used chiefly as a flavoring agent and in perfumery. Eng.

wā pā·ʻani kik Recess, as during school. Lit., time (for) playing.

wā·wae kik Leg. Dic. See entry below and aʻa kino kū wāwae, aʻa puʻuwai kū wāwae, iwi kū wāwae, iwi manamana wāwae, iwi pili wāwae, iwi poli wāwae. Wāwae noho. Chair leg. Wāwae pākaukau. Table leg.

wā·wae kik Ray, as in geometry. Legendre. Also ʻaoʻao.

wā·wae·ʻala·lā kik Crow's feet, a kind of plant. Comb. wāwae + ʻalalā.

wā·wae·ʻami kik Arthropod. Lit., jointed legs.

wā·wahi ham To break, change, as a twenty-dollar bill. Dic. See entry below.

wā·wahi ham To break apart, i.e. breaking a number into addends or factors, in math. Dic., ext. mng.

wā·wahie kik Fuel. Trad. (redup. of wahie). See uila puhi wāwahie. Wāwahie mōʻalihaku. Fossil fuel. Also wāwahie wīhaku.

wawe Helu wawe. Hotline. Helu wawe maluō. Conservation hotline.

waʻa kai·aka kik Kayak. Comb. waʻa + Eng.

waʻa ʻlli·kini kik Canoe without ʻiako. Lit., Indian canoe.

waʻu ham To scratch, as an itch. Dic. Also waʻuwaʻu. Cf. walu.

wā ʻukē kik Period of a pendulum. Lit., time (of) pendulum swing.

wehe ham To open, remove. Dic. See entry below. Mea wehe kini. Can opener. Mea wehe ʻūmiʻi. Staple remover.

wehe ham To open, as a file in a computer program. Dic., ext. mng. See pani. Wehe i ke kī wai. To turn on the water. Niʻihau.

wehena papa·hana kik Opening ceremonies. Lit., program opening.

wehe·wehe See papa wehewehe ʻōlelo. Leka wehewehe. Cover letter.

wehi kik Ornament. Dic. Wehi lāʻau Kalikimaka. Christmas tree ornament. Pōpō wehi lāʻau Kalikimaka. Christmas ball, the tree ornament.

weke·lia kik Wedelia, a ground cover. Eng.

wela ʻaʻ Temperature, when weather considered hot. ʻEhia ka wela o kēia lā? What's the temperature today? Lit., hot. Cf. anu, mahana, mehana. See kēkelē, wela lōpū.

wē·lau kik Pole. Dic. Wēlau ʻākau. North pole. Wēlau hema. South pole.

wē·lau alelo kik Tip of the tongue. Lit., tongue tip. See kūʻau alelo, lau alelo, mole alelo, waena alelo.

wela lōpū ʻaʻ Medium heat.

wele kik Rarefaction, i.e. the least dense concentration of wave particles in a compressional wave. Sh. wāele. Cf. ulu. See hawewe papamoe.

wele·lau kik Tip of a leaf, as hala. Man. Also hiʻu. Cf. poʻo.

Wele·moneka iʻoa Vermont; Vermonter. Dic. Also Veremona, Veremoneta.

 

weli kik Scion. Dic.

welo kik Hereditary trait. Dic., ext. mng. Cf. ōewe. See kumu welo.

welo·welo Hōkū welowelo. Shooting star.

welu ʻeha kik Gauze. Lit., injury rag. Also welu wahīʻeha (Niʻihau), ʻaʻamoʻo (dic.).

welu ʻili kik Chamois, chamois cloth. Lit., leather rag.

wena·kawa kik Vena cava, i.e. any of the large veins by which the blood is returned to the right atrium of the heart. Latin. Also aʻa kino wenakawa. Wenakawa o luna. Superior vena cava. Wenakawa o lalo. Inferior vena cava.

Wene See kiʻikuhi Wene.

Wene·zuela iʻoa Venezuela. Eng.

Wenuke iʻoa Venus, the name. Eng. Also Wenuse.

Wedele iʻoa Weddell. Eng. Ke kai ʻo Wedele. Weddell Sea.

Wieka·nama iʻoa Vietnam; Vietnamese. Eng.

wī·haku kik Fossil. Sh. iwi + pōhaku. Also mōʻalihaku.

wika·mina kik Vitamin. Eng. Also witamina.

wiki See pihi wiki.

wiki·ō kik Video. Eng. Lola wikiō. Video cassette. Pahu paʻi wikiō. Camcorder, video camera.

wiki·ola kik Vitriol. Eng. Also witiola.

Wī·kini kik Viking. Eng.

wī·kō·lia Pua wīkōlia. Rhododendron.

Wikone·kina iʻoa Wisconsin; Wisconsinite. Dic. Also Wikonesina.

Wikone·sina iʻoa Wisconsin; Wisconsinite. Dic. Also Wikonekina.

wili ham To dial, as a telephone; to drill; to twirl, as a baton. Dic.; dic., ext. mng. See kumuwili, makawili, pā wili, pihi wili, wili i hope, wili i mua, ʻaukaʻi wili.

wili ham To turn, as a figure, in math. Dic., ext. mng. Kikowaena wili. Turn center. Kinona like wili hapahā. Quarter-turn image. ʻĀlikelike wili. Rotational symmetry. See ʻālikelike.

wili·au kik Eddy. Dic. Wai wiliau. Side pool, as in a stream. Wiliau hōkū. Galaxy.

wili·aho kik Reel, as for fishing. Mān. (comb. wili + aho). Wiliaho hāmama. Open reel. Wiliaho hekau maunu. Bait-casting reel.

wili i hope ham To rewind, as a film or audio tape. Lit., wind back. See wili i mua.

wili i mua ham To fast forward, as a film or audio tape. Lit., wind forward. See wili i hope.

wili·ō See manu wiliō.

wili hoʻo·mā·lō kik Banding tool, as for putting metal bands on boxes, water tanks, etc. Lit., drill (for) stretching. See kalapu hao.

Wili·kinia iʻoa Virginia; Virginian. Dic. Wilikinia Komohana. West Virginia; West Virginian.

wili niho ham Dentist's drill. Lit., tooth drill. See ʻōhiki kauka niho.

wili·pā kik Disc jockey. Lit., "spin" records. Also wilipāleo.

wili·paipu kik Plumber. Lit., turn pipe. Also kanaka hoʻomoe paipu. Cf. wilikī (dic.).

wili ʻaila kik Oil rig, for drilling oil on either land or sea. Lit., oil drill.

wili·ʻō·kaʻi kik Chrysalis. Dic.

wini·kili·kini kik Vincristine, an alkaloid derived from the periwinkle. Eng.

wiʻu ʻaʻ Pungent, sharp, as the smell of ammonia or vinegar. Dic., new mng. Nalo wiʻu. Midge fly.

wisa kik Visa, i.e. an endorsement made on a passport by proper authorities denoting it has been examined and that the bearer may proceed. Eng.

 

 

wita·mina kik Vitamin. Eng. Also wikamina.

witi·ola kik Vitriol. Eng. Also wikiola.

woela kik Vowel, in linguistics. Eng. See entries below and hoʻēmi woela, pua woela.

woela emi kik Reduced vowel, in linguistics.

woela haʻa·haʻa kik Low vowel, in linguistics.

woela kau·hope kik Back vowel, in linguistics. Comb. woela + kau + hope.

woela kau·mua kik Front vowel, in linguistics. Comb. woela + kau + mua.

woela kau·waena kik Central vowel, in linguistics. Comb. woela + kau + waena.

woela kiʻe·kiʻe kik High vowel, in linguistics.

woela mā·lō kik Tense vowel, in linguistics. Lit., taut vowel.

woela mō·kio kik Rounded vowel, in linguistics. Lit., pucker vowel.

woela ʻalu kik Lax vowel, in linguistics. Lit., slackened vowel.

ʻ

ʻā ʻaʻ Active, as a volcano. Dic., ext. mng. Lua pele ʻā. Active volcano.

ʻae ham To lend, not to borrow. E ʻoluʻolu e ʻae mai i kāu peni. Please lend me your pen; may I borrow your pen? Mān.

ʻae omo·waho kik Solvent front, i.e. the leading edge of a moving solvent as in a developing chromatogram. Lit., adsorbing edge; cf. ʻae kai (dic.).

ʻAe·keana iʻoa Aegean. Eng. Ke kai ʻo ʻAekeana. Aegean Sea.

ʻāeko poʻo hina kik Bald eagle. Lit., white-haired eagle. Also ʻāeto poʻo hina.

ʻae·like See entries below. Hoʻokuʻu ʻaelike. To cede, as land or territory. Kūkaʻi ʻaelike 'uniona. Collective bargaining.

ʻae·like hoʻōki kik Cloture, i.e. a method of ending debate and causing an immediate vote to be taken. Ke hāpai maila ka luna hoʻomalu o ka ʻaha kenekoa e komo i ka ʻaelike hoʻōki i hiki ke hoʻopau i ka paio kālaimanaʻo a hoʻoholo i ka pila. The senate leader is proposing that the session enter into cloture so that the debate can end and the bill be decided. Lit., agreement (to) terminate (debate).

ʻae·like mā·lama kā·nā·wai kik Compact, i.e. a written agreement to make and obey laws for the welfare of the group. Lit., agreement (to) maintain laws.

ʻae·ʻae ʻaʻ Fine, as sand. Niʻihau/dic. Cf. mānoanoa.

ʻāeto See ʻāeko poʻo hina.

ʻai kik Point, as in a game or sporting event. Dic. See entries below and heluʻai, kāpuka ʻai, lāʻau make ʻai, lilo ka ʻai iā Mea.

ʻai kik Byte, in computer terminology. Dic., ext. mng. See huna, ʻai pākaukani, ʻai pāmiliona, ʻai pāpiliona.

ʻai kik Credit, as for a school course. Dic., ext. mng. ʻAi koina. Core credit. ʻAi koho. Elective credit.

ʻai ham To take, as medicine or a pill. Dic., ext. mng. Cf. inu. ʻAi i ka huaale. To take a pill. ʻAi i ka lāʻau. To take medicine.

ʻaia·ola heh To eat nutritious food. Comb. ʻai + a + ola. Cf. paiola. Kūlana ʻaiaola. Nutrition.

ʻAio·ā iʻoa Iowa; Iowan. Eng. Also ʻIoa.

ʻai hā·ʻawi wale kik Ace, in volleyball. Niʻihau. Also ʻeki.

 

ʻai hele wale kik Point from block, dink, or spike, in volleyball. Niʻihau.

ʻai hemo ham To remove food from one's mouth and then eat it again, as gum. Mān. (MMLH).

ʻai hī·naʻi kik Basket, a score in basketball. Lit., basket score. See ʻai kolu.

ʻai holo kik Touchdown, in football. Lit., run score. Cf. ʻai hopu, ʻai manuahi, ʻai peku.

ʻai hopu kik Touchback, in football. Lit., catch score. Cf. ʻai holo, ʻai manuahi, ʻai peku.

ʻai·hue ham To steal, in basketball. ʻAihue akula ʻo Kevin Johnson i ke kinipōpō, a holo akula no ka ʻai. Kevin Johnson stole the ball and went in for the goal. Dic.

ʻai·kalima kik Ice cream. Dic. Kone ʻaikalima. Ice cream cone. ʻAikalima ʻau. Popsicle. Cf. kanakē ʻau.

ʻai keu kik Extra credit, bonus. Lit., extra point. Also hoʻopiʻi kaha. Nīnau ʻai keu. Extra-credit question, bonus question. Also nīnau hoʻopiʻi kaha.

ʻAi·kiopa iʻoa Ethiopia; Ethiopian. Dic.

ʻai kolu kik A successful three-point shot, in basketball. Ua komo ka ʻai kolu a ke kī miomio ʻana a Piʻikea, Piʻikea's expertly shot three-pointer went in. Lit., three points. See ʻai hīnaʻi. Kī ʻai kolu. Three-point shot; to attempt such a shot.

ʻAiku·pika iʻoa Egypt; Egyptian. Dic. Also ʻAikupita, ʻAigupita.

ʻaila·hola kik Gasohol. Sh. ʻaila + ʻalekohola.

ʻaila hoʻo·hinu·hinu kik Wax, as for polishing a car. Lit., oil (for) polishing.

ʻaila kā kik Petroleum. Lit., tar oil. Also ʻaila tā.

ʻaila·kele kik Fat. Comb. ʻaila + kele. See entries below and haʻakupu ʻailakele, ʻaʻaʻa hunaola ʻailakele. Meaʻai ʻailakele iki. Low-fat food. Also meaʻai liʻiliʻi o ka ʻailakele. Meaʻai ʻailakele nui. High-fat food. Also meaʻai nui o ka ʻailakele.

ʻaila·kele lau·paʻa·hapa kik Polyunsaturated fat. Comb. ʻailakele + lau + paʻa + hapa. Cf. ʻailakele paʻahapa, ʻailakele paʻapū.

ʻaila·kele paʻa·hapa kik Unsaturated fat. Comb. ʻailakele + paʻa + hapa. Cf. ʻailakele laupaʻahapa, ʻailakele paʻapū.

ʻaila·kele paʻa·pū kik Saturated fat. Lit., dense fat. Cf. ʻailakele laupaʻahapa, ʻailakele paʻahapa.

ʻaila mea·kanu kik Vegetable oil. Lit., plant oil. See lauʻai.

ʻAi·lana Kanaka iʻoa Isle of Man.

ʻaila pale lā kik Sunscreen, the lotion. Lit., ointment (to) protect (against) sun. Cf. ʻaila ʻōlala.

ʻaila ʻaʻalo paʻa·hau kik Antifreeze. Lit., oil (to) resist freezing.

ʻaila ʻō·lala kik Suntan lotion. Lit., ointment (for) basking (in the sun). Cf. ʻaila pale lā.

ʻAi·liki iʻoa Irish. Dic. See ʻIlelani

ʻai manu·ahi kik Point after touchdown, in football. Lit., free point. See ʻai holo, ʻai hopu, ʻai peku. ʻAi manuahi holo. Point after by passing or running. ʻAi manuahi peku. Point after by kicking.

ʻaina See lumi ʻaina.

ʻāina kik Country. Dic. See entries below. Aloha ʻāina. Nationalism, patriotism. ʻĀina ʻoiʻenehana. Developed or First World Country. ʻĀina hōʻoiʻenehana. Developing or Third World Country.

 

ʻāina Hoʻohana ʻāina. Land use, in geography. Komikina Hoʻohana ʻĀina o ka Mokuʻāina. State Land Use Commission. ʻOihana Kumuwaiwai ʻĀina. Department of Land and Natural Resources (DLNR). ʻŌnaehana Hoʻomalu ʻĀina Kūlohelohe. Natural Areas Reserves System (NARS).

ʻai·nao·nao kik Anteater. Comb. ʻai + naonao.

ʻāina hoʻo·malu kik Reserve, i.e. a reservation or tract of land set apart. Lit., land (to) protect. ʻĀina hoʻomalu ao kūlohelohe. Nature reserve. ʻĀina hoʻomalu ululāʻau. Forest reserve.

ʻĀina Hoʻo·malu Holo·holona Lō·hiu o Hawaiʻi kik Hawaiian Islands National Wildlife Refuge.

ʻāina kula lau·laha kik Plain, an expanse of flat land. Lit., widespread-plain land. Also kula laulaha. Cf. nuʻu laulaha.

ʻāina kumu wai kik Watershed, i.e. an area from which water drains. Lit., water source land. ʻĀina kumu wai kiwikā. Municipal watershed.

ʻāina loli·loli kik Transition area, i.e. an area where natural topography changes from one land feature to another. Lit., changing land.

ʻāina mauʻu kik Grassland.

ʻāina muli pana·lā·ʻau kik Post-colonial country. Lit., after-colony land. Also kaumokuʻāina muli panalāʻau.

ʻāina no ka lehu·lehu kik Public land. Kaʻa nā ʻāina no ka lehulehu ma lalo o ka hoʻomalu ʻia ʻana o ke aupuni o ka Mokuʻāina. Public lands fall under the administration of the State government. Lit., land for the public. Cf. ʻalokio.

ʻĀina Pā·kē iʻoa China. Dic. Also Kina. See Pākē.

ʻĀina Pili·pino iʻoa Philippines. Dic. Also ʻĀina Pinopino.

ʻĀina Pino·pino iʻoa Philippines. Niʻihau. Also ʻĀina Pilipino.

ʻāina·puni·ʻole kik Continent. Dic. Also mokuhonua. See mokuhonua.

ʻāina ʻē Kelepona ʻāina ʻē. International call; to make such a call. Kōkua ʻāina ʻē. Foreign aid, as a government policy. Kulekele ʻāina ʻē. Foreign policy, as a government function.

ʻĀina·ʻō·maʻo·maʻo Ke kai ʻo ʻĀinaʻōmaʻomaʻo. Greenland Sea.

ʻai·nohu Kau·ō kik Laysan finch (telespiza cantanc). Comb. ʻai + nohu + Kauō. See hona, nuku ʻekue, ʻainohu Nīhoa.

ʻai·nohu Nī·hoa kik Nīhoa finch (telespiza ultima). Comb. ʻai + nohu + Nīhoa. See hona, nuku ʻekue, ʻainohu Kauō.

ʻai pā·kau·kani kik Kilobyte (K), in computer terminology. Lit., thousandfold byte. Abb. PK. Seeʻai.

ʻai pā·mili·ona kik Megabyte (Meg), in computer terminology. Lit., millionfold byte. Abb. PM. See ʻai.

ʻai pā·pili·ona kik Gigabyte, in computer terminology. Lit., billionfold byte. Abb. PP. See ʻai

ʻai peku kik Field goal, in football. Lit., kick score. Cf. ʻai holo, ʻai hopu, ʻai manuahi.

ʻai puni kik Home run. Lit., lap score.

ʻaiwi kik Ivy. Eng. Also lau hihi pā.

ʻai·ʻē kik Loan, i.e. money lent at interest; to have a loan. Dic., ext. mng. Also lako ʻaiʻē. Cf. hoʻolako ʻaiʻē, lawe ʻaiʻē.

ʻAigu·pita iʻoa Egypt; Egyptian. Dic., sp. var. Also ʻAikupika, ʻAikupita.

ʻao Abbreviation for ʻaoʻao (page).

ʻao·ʻao kik Leg or side, of a triangle. Dic., ext. mng. See entries below and kukuna, ʻaoʻao huli alo, ʻaoʻao launa, ʻaoʻao pili.

ʻao·ʻao See kīloi ʻaoʻao. ʻAu ʻaoʻao. Side stroke, in swimming; to swim the side stroke.

 

ʻAo·ʻao iʻoa Almak, a star. Mān. (HA).

ʻao·ʻao inoa See ʻaoʻao hoʻākāka.

ʻao·ʻao hapa nui kik Majority party, in politics. Cf. ʻaoʻao hapa ʻuʻuku, ʻaoʻao kālaiʻāina.

ʻao·ʻao hapa ʻuʻuku kik Minority party, in politics. Cf. ʻaoʻao hapa nui, ʻaoʻao kālaiʻāina.

ʻao·ʻao hoʻā·kāka kik Cover page. Ua loaʻa ka inoa a me ka helu wahi o ka mea kākau ma ka ʻaoʻao hoʻākāka. The author's name and address are found on the cover page. Lit., explanation page. Also ʻaoʻao inoa.

ʻao·ʻao hoʻo·piʻi kik Prosecution, i.e. the prosecuting party in a court case. Lit., side (to) bring a complaint. Cf. ʻaoʻao kūpale. See loio hoʻopiʻi, mea hoʻopiʻi.

ʻao·ʻao huli alo kik Opposite leg or side, of a right triangle. Lit., side (which) faces (the right angle). See ʻaoʻao pili.

ʻao·ʻao kau kik Base, as of a triangle, in math. Lit., placing side. Abb. ʻak.

ʻao·ʻao kā·lai·ʻāina kik Political party. See ʻaoʻao hapa nui, ʻaoʻao hapa ʻuʻuku.

ʻao·ʻao kū·pale kik Defense, in sports. Lit., defending side. See entry below. Also ʻaoʻao pale.

ʻao·ʻao kū·pale kik Defense, i.e. the defendant's case or counsel in a lawsuit. Lit., side (which) defends. Cf. ʻaoʻao hoʻopiʻi. See loio kūpale, mea hoʻopiʻi.

ʻao·ʻao launa kik Corresponding side, of a triangle. Lit., associating side. See ʻaoʻao huli alo, ʻaoʻao pili.

ʻao·ʻao like ʻole kik Scalene, in math. Lit., dissimilar sides. Huinakolu ʻaoʻao like ʻole. Scalene triangle.

ʻao·ʻao pale kik Defense, in sports. Lit., defense side. Also ʻaoʻao kūpale.

ʻao·ʻao pili kik Adjacent leg or side, of a right triangle. Lit., adjoining side. See ʻaoʻao huli alo.

ʻao·ʻao ʻelua Aupuni ʻaoʻao ʻelua. Two-party system of government.

ʻau kik Handle, as of a bureau drawer, faucet, frying pan, toilet, etc. (preceded by ke); neck, as of an ʻukulele, guitar, etc. Dic.; Niʻihau. Cf. kākai, pōheo. See ʻau hoʻokuʻu wai o ka lua, ʻau kī wai, ʻau paikikala, ʻau pā palai, ʻau ʻume. See also ʻukulele.

ʻau·ae See ʻumiʻumi ʻauae.

ʻau·aʻa kik Rhizome. Lit., root stem.

ʻau·ina kik Band, gradient, as of colors. Dic., ext. mng. ʻAuina kala. Color band, color gradient.

ʻau umauma heh Breast stroke; to swim the breast stroke. Dic.

ʻau·hau kik Tax. Dic. Mea uku ʻauhau. Taxpayer. Pākēneka ʻauhau. Tax rate. ʻAuhau komo pū. Tax included.ʻAuhau kumukūʻai. Sales tax.

ʻau·hō·kū kik Delphinium. Comb. ʻau + hōkū. Also pua ʻauhōkū.

ʻau hoʻo·kuʻu wai o ka lua kik Toilet handle (preceded by ke). Also ʻau hoʻokuʻu.

ʻau·hua kik Corm, scientific usage. Comb. ʻau + hua. See hua.

ʻAuk. Abbreviation for ʻAukake (August).

ʻauka ʻaʻ Out, in baseball. Ua ʻauka wau iā ia. He put me out. Dic. Cf. hala akula i waho. See hōʻauka.

ʻau·kā See entries below. Pakuhi ʻaukā. Bar graph. Pakuhi paʻa ʻaukā. Double bar graph. Papa ʻaukā helu. Ten-strip board, in math.

ʻau·kā helu hapa ʻumi kik Tenth strip, in math. Lit., strip (to) count tenths. See moena helu hapa haneli, papa ʻaukā helu.

ʻau·kā holo·mua kik Fill bar, in a computer program. Lit., bar (showing) progress.

ʻAu·kake iʻoa August. Dic. Abb. ʻAuk.

 

ʻau·kā kō·kua helu kik Counting rod or strip, in math. Lit., bar (to) help count. Also ʻaukā. Cf. moena kōkua helu, paʻaʻiliono kōkua helu.

ʻau·kaʻi kik Baton. Comb. ʻau + kaʻi. See entries below.

ʻau·kaʻi pāna kik Signal baton, as used by a marching bandleader. Lit., baton (for directing) bands.

ʻau·kaʻi wili kik Baton for twirling. See wili.

ʻAu·keku·lia iʻoa Austria; Austrian. Dic. Also ʻAuseturia.

ʻau kī wai kik Faucet handle (preceded by ke). See kī wai.

ʻau kolo heh Free style, crawl, in swimming; to swim using this syle. Dic.

ʻau kua heh Back stroke, in swimming; to swim the back stroke. Lit., swim (on the) back.

ʻau·lahi kik Strip, as in a stripmat counting system, in math (preceded by ke). Sh. ʻau + lahilahi.

ʻau·laʻo kik Twig, small stick (preceded by ke). Sh. ʻau + laʻolaʻo.

ʻau·liliʻi ʻaʻ Precision; precise. Redup. of ʻauliʻi.

ʻau mā·lolo heh Butterfly stroke, in swimming; to swim the butterfly stroke. Lit., swim (like) a mālolo fish.

ʻau·mana kik Tributary. He ʻaumana ʻo Misouri no Misisipi. The Missouri is a tributary of the Mississippi. Comb. ʻau + mana. ʻAumana kahawai. Stream tributary. ʻAumana muliwai. River tributary.

ʻAu·mani iʻoa Alnitak, a star. Mān. (HA).

ʻau moku kaua kik Navy. Trad. Also pūʻali kaua moana, ʻoihana moku.

ʻau·neki kik Ounce. Dic. Abb. ʻan. ʻAuneki wai. Fluid ounce. Abb. ʻan w.

ʻau pai·kikala kik Handlebars, on a bicycle (preceded by ke). Niʻihau. Also kalaiwa paikikala.

ʻau pā palai kik Frying pan handle (preceded by ke).

ʻau·waha kik Geologic trench, as Aleutian Trench. Dic., ext. mng. Ka ʻauwaha ʻo ʻAleuta. Aleutian Trench.

ʻauʻa Hoʻopaʻi ʻauʻa. Detention, as punishment at school. Hoʻopaʻi ʻauʻa i ka wā kula. In-school detention. Hoʻopaʻi ʻauʻa muli kula. After-school detention.

ʻau ʻao·ʻao heh Side stroke, in swimming; to swim the side stroke. Lit., swim (on the) side.

ʻau·ʻau kili·lau heh To take a shower, bathe by showering. See kililau, lumi ʻauʻau.

ʻau·ʻauna manu kik Birdbath. Lit., bird bathing place.

ʻau·ʻau paipu hanu heh To snorkel. See paipu hanu.

ʻau ʻī·lio heh Dog paddle, in swimming; to dog paddle. Lit., swim (like a) dog.

ʻau ʻume kik Drawer handle (preceded by ke). Cf. pōheo ʻume.

ʻAu·setu·ria iʻoa Austria; Austrian. Dic., sp. var. Also ʻAukekulia.

ʻaha kik Council. Dic., ext. mng. See entries below. ʻAha kalana. County council.

ʻAha Au·puni Hui Pū ʻia kik United Nations (UN). Lit., conference of unified nations.

ʻaha hoʻo·kolo·kolo Māhele ʻaha hoʻokolokolo. Judicial branch, of a government.

ʻaha hoʻo·kuʻi·kahi kik Convention, i.e. an assembly of people who meet for a common purpose, in politics. Lit., convention (for) unifying.

ʻaha hoʻo·lohe kik Hearing, i.e. a time for presenting official testimony or argument. E mālama ʻia ana kekahi ʻaha hoʻolohe e pili ana i nā kuleana wai o ka ʻaoʻao Koʻolau o Oʻahu i Kāneʻohe i kēia ahiahi. A hearing will be

 

held regarding water rights on the windward side of Oʻahu in Kāneʻohe this evening. Lit., gathering (for) listening. Also hālāwai hoʻolohe.

ʻAha Hoʻo·malu Lawaiʻa o ka Pā·kī pika Komo·hana kik Western Pacific Fishery Management Council.

ʻaha hoʻo·nā ʻāina kik Land court. Lit., court (for) settling land claims.

ʻAha·hui Maka ·ʻala Holo·holona kik Humane Society. Lit., society (which) attends to animals.

ʻaha·huina kik Corporation, i.e. a business that is separate from the people who own it and acts legally as a single entity. Comb. ʻahahui + -na.

ʻaha koi pohō ʻuʻuku kik Small-claims court, small-debts court. Ua hoʻopiʻi ʻia ka wahine i ka ʻaha koi pohō ʻuʻuku e hoʻonā ai i ka hihia o nā kini ʻōpala i hōʻino ʻia. The woman was taken to small-claims court to settle the case of the damaged trash cans. Lit., court (to) sue for small claims or damages.

ʻaha kuhina kik Cabinet, a council that advises a president, sovereign, etc. Ua hoʻokohu ʻia ʻo Keoki Kahaele i ka ʻaha kuhina no ka nui o kōna kākoʻo a kōkua i ka Pelekikena i kōna holo moho ʻana. Keoki Kahaele was appointed to the cabinet for his great support and help to the President in his campaign efforts. Dic.

ʻaha kū-kā kik Conference. Dic. Cf. hui. See entry below.

ʻaha kū·kā poʻo au·puni kik Summit, i.e. a conference of highest-level officials, as heads of government. ʻO ke poʻomanaʻo kūkā nui ma ka ʻaha kūkā poʻo aupuni, ʻo ia ka hoʻokele waiwai ʻana. The main topic of discussion at the summit was the economy. Lit., conference (of) government heads.

ʻaha pane hoʻo·piʻi kik Arraignment, i.e. a court hearing in which a defendant is formally charged with a crime and enters a plea of guilty or not guilty. Hoʻopiʻi paʻalula ʻia ke kanaka ma ka ʻaha pane hoʻopiʻi, a pane akula ʻo ia ʻaʻohe ōna kū i ka hewa. The man was formally charged in the arraignment wherein he entered a plea of not guilty. Lit., court (for) answering accusation. See hoʻopiʻi kūʻē.

ʻaha·ʻaina kik Banquet. Dic.ʻAhaʻaina hoʻokipa. Welcome banquet. ʻAhaʻaina panina. Closing banquet.

ʻā·haʻi kik Halfback, in football. Dic., new mng.

ʻaha·ʻō·lelo Kānāwai ʻahaʻōlelo. Statute, i.e. a law enacted by the legislative branch of a government. Māhele ʻahaʻōlelo. Legislative branch, of a government. ʻĀpana ʻahaʻōlelo lāhui. Congressional district.

ʻā·hia kik Powdery tinder. Dic. Cf. pulupulu (dic.).

ʻā·hiu ʻaʻ Wild, general term; shy. Dic. Cf. lapa. See lōhiu, lakauā.

ʻā·hina·hina ʻō-maʻo-maʻo kik Maui greensword. Lit., green silversword.

ʻā·holo kik Avalanche, landslide. Dic., sp. var. ʻĀholo hau. Snow avalanche.

ʻahu honua kik Earth's mantle.

ʻā·huli kik/heh Mutation; to mutate. He ʻāhuli ia o ke ōewe. It's a mutation in the gene. Var. of kāhuli.

ʻak Abbreviation for ʻaoʻao kau (base).

ʻĀk Abbreviation for ʻākau (north).

ʻā·kau kik North. Dic. Abb. ʻĀk. See wēlau ʻākau. Ke Kai ʻĀkau. North Sea. Kōʻai ʻākau. Clockwise. Poepoe hapa ʻākau. Northern hemisphere.

ʻaka·kiu kik Cashew. (Tupi acajú.)

ʻAkana·kā iʻoa Arkansas; Arkansan. Dic., sp. var. Also ʻAkanasā.

 

ʻAkana·sā iʻoa Arkansas; Arkansan. Dic., sp. var. Also ʻAkanakā.

ʻakano kik Substance. PPN kakano (body). See kumumea, meakino, pūhui. ʻAkano laukua. Amorphous substance.

ʻaka·ʻakai See ilo ʻakaʻakai, lina, ʻoʻa.

ʻā·kaʻa·kaʻa ʻaʻ To be peeling, as skin from sunburn. Dic.

ʻā·kea kik Starboard hull of a double-hulled canoe or right side of a ship when looking forward. Dic., ext. mng. Cf. ama, muku.

ʻā·keka kik Acetate, a salt/ester of ascetic acid. Eng. ʻĀkeka ʻeto. Ethyl acetate.

ʻā·keke kik Cinder. Dic. See one ʻā. Puʻu ʻākeke. Cinder cone.

ʻake·kona kik Acetone. Eng.

ʻAke·lanika iʻoa Atlantic. Dic. Also ʻAtelanika.

ʻAke·pai·kana iʻoa Azerbaijan. Eng.

ʻā·keʻa ham To block out or screen, in basketball. Ua neʻe akula ʻo Kalama i mua o Mānai no ka ʻākeʻa ʻana i kā ia ala ʻāpō ʻana mai. Kalama moved in front of Mānai to block out his attempt to rebound. Comb. ʻā- + keʻa. See entries below.

ʻā·keʻa neʻe ham Illegal screen, in basketball. ʻAʻole hiki ke ʻākeʻa neʻe i ke kūpale me ka holo pū ʻana. Screening while moving along with the defender is not allowed. Lit., moving screen. See kuʻia ʻākeʻa.

ʻā·keʻa ʻū·niu ham Pick and roll, in basketball; to make such a play. Paʻakikī ke kaupale ʻana i ke kaʻaneʻe ʻākeʻa ʻūniu. Defending the pick and roll play is tough. Lit., pivot screen.

ʻĀ·kia iʻoa Asia; Asian, Asiatic. Dic. Also ʻĀsia.

ʻakiu ham To probe. Dic. ʻAkiu lewa lipo. Space probe.

ʻakika kik Acid. Dic. Pepa ana ʻakika. Litmus paper, for measuring pH. ʻAkika haidorokoloriku. Hydrochloric acid. ʻAkika kalapona. Carbonic acid. ʻAkika naikokene. Nitric acid. Also ʻakika nikiriku. ʻAkika pūhui kalapona. Carboxylic acid. ʻAkika ʻūpalu kūlohelohe. Naturally occurring weak acid. ʻAkika forimiku. Formic acid. ʻAkika sulufuriku. Sulfuric acid. ʻAkika tanika. Tannic acid. ʻAnahai- daraside ʻakika. Acidic anhydride.

ʻā·kili·kai kik Alkali; alkaline. Comb. ʻā- + kili + kai. Mekala ʻākilikai. Alkali metal, i.e. one of the family of elements in Group 1 of the periodic table. Mekala honua ʻākilikai. Alkaline earth metal, i.e. one of the family of elements in Group 2 of the periodic table.

ʻAkili·kika iʻoa Adriatic. Eng. Ke kai ʻo ʻAkilikika. Adriatic Sea.

ʻā·kili·lehu kik Lye. Sh. ʻākilikai + lehu.

ʻAki·mika iʻoa Archimedes. Eng. Ke kulehana a ʻAkimika. Archimedes' principle, i.e. the buoyant force on an object submerged in a fluid is equal to the weight of the fluid displaced by that object, in science.

ʻakino·ika kik Actinoid, i.e. one of the fourteen elements that follow actinium on the periodic table. Eng.

ʻā·kō·lī See kōkua hua mele.

ʻakomi ʻaʻ Automatic. Eng. Hānai ʻakomi. To auto feed, continuous feed, as paper into a computer printer.

ʻā·kope kik Caffeine. Comb. ʻā- + kope.

ʻako·pie See uinihapa ʻakopie.

ʻā kua·lua ʻaʻ Secondary activity, of a volcano. Comb. ʻā + kualua.

ʻaku·iki kik Chipmonk. (Ute ʻakwiisi.) Also kiulela ʻakuiki.

ʻā·kule·ana Mana ʻākuleana. Delegated powers, as of Congress.

 

ʻā·kuli·kuli kula kik Portulaca. Dic.

ʻalā Iwi ʻalā. Cortical bone. Pōhaku ʻalā. Boulder, in Hawaiʻi, referring to poi pounder-size stones and larger. Cf. nukahaku.

ʻalaea kik Tribe, i.e. people in a district who have intermarried, specifically referring to Hawaiʻi. Dic. Cf. hapū, nāki.

ʻĀ·laka iʻoa Alaska; Alaskan. Dic. Also ʻAlaseka.

ʻala·kaine kik Alkyne. Eng. Cf. ʻalakane, ʻalakene. Pūkaʻina ʻalakaine. Alkyne series, i.e. the group of unsaturated hydrocarbons with one triple bond.

ʻala·kaloida kik Alkaloid. Eng.

ʻala·kane kik Alkane. Eng. Cf. ʻalakaine, ʻalakene. Pūkaʻina ʻalakane. Alkane series, i.e. saturated hydrocarbons where all the carbon atoms are joined by single covalent bonds.

ʻala·keka kik Alligator. Eng.

ʻala·kene kik Alkene. Eng. Cf. ʻalakaine, ʻalakane. Pūkaʻina ʻalakene. Alkene series, i.e. the group of unsaturated hydrocarbons with one double bond.

ʻAlala iʻoa Aral. Eng. Ke kai ʻo ʻAlala. Aral Sea.

ʻala·meka kik Nutmeg. Sh. huaʻala + Eng.

ʻala·neo Lulu ʻalaneo. Rain shadow.

ʻā·lani Poloka kau lāʻau ʻālani. Orange tree frog.

ʻala·nine kik Alanine, an amino acid. Eng.

ʻā·lani pomelo kik Grapefruit. Lit., pomelo orange. See iāpona, pomelo.

ʻā·lapa kik/ʻaʻ Athlete; athletic. Dic. Haʻawina kālā ʻālapa. Athletic scholarship.

ʻala·paina ʻaʻ Alpine, i.e. relating to the biogeographic zone above timberline. Eng. See lalo ʻalapaina, wao laʻalāʻau. Panoa ʻalapaina. Alpine desert.

ʻā·lapa·kona- Prefix (Haw.); suffix (Eng.) -athalon. Comb. ʻālapa + kona. See entries below.

ʻā·lapa ·kona·kolu kik Triathalon. Comb. ʻālapakona- + kolu.

ʻā·lapa·kona·lima kik Pentathalon. Comb. ʻālapakona- + lima.

ʻā·lapa·kona·ʻumi kik Decathalon. Comb. ʻālapakona- + ʻumi.

ʻAla·pama iʻoa Alabama; Alabaman, Alabamian. Dic. Also ʻAlabama.

ʻAla·pia iʻoa Arabia, Arabian. Dic. Also ʻArabia. Aupuni ʻEmira ʻAlapia Hui Pū ʻia. United Arab Emirates. Ke kai ʻo ʻAlapia. Arabian Sea. Saudi ʻAlapia. Saudi Arabia; Saudi. Also Saudi ʻArabia.

ʻAla·bama iʻoa Alabama; Alabaman, Alabamian. Dic., sp. var. Also ʻAlapama.

ʻAla·bania iʻoa Albania; Albanian. Eng. Also ʻAlepania.

ʻAla·seka iʻoa Alaska; Alaskan. Dic., sp. var. Also ʻĀlaka.

ʻale kik Wave, as a swell in the open ocean. Dic. Cf. nalu. See hokua, honua, kiʻekiʻena, kōā.

ʻale ahi lā kik Solar granule, i.e. gigantic waves of gas which roll across the surface of the sun. Lit., wave (of) solar fire. Cf. kiko lā, lapa ahi lā, puapuaʻi lā.

ʻAle·uta iʻoa Aleut; Aleutian. Eng. Ka pae ʻāina ʻo ʻAleuia. Aleutian Islands. Ka ʻauwaha ʻo ʻAleuta. Aleutian Trench.

ʻale·kea kik Heron, general term. Dic. See ʻalekuʻu.

ʻAle·kelia iʻoa Algeria; Algerian. Dic. Also ʻAlegeria.

ʻAle·kina iʻoa Argentina; Argentine, Argentinean. Eng.

ʻale·kohola kik Alcohol. Dic.

ʻale kua·kea kik Whitecap. Dic. See niho.

 

ʻale·kuʻu kik Egret, general term. Papapū ka ʻāina mahi kō i ka ʻalekuʻu kau pipi ma hope o ka puhi ʻana i ke kō. The cane field is covered with cattle egrets after the cane is burned. Sh. ʻalekea + ʻaukuʻu. See ʻalekea. ʻAlekuʻu kau pipi. Cattle egret.

ʻale·manaka kik Calendar. Dic. ʻAlemanaka puke. Date book, appointment book. Cf. puke ʻalemanaka.

ʻā·lepa kik Alpha. Dic., sp. var. Huna ʻālepa. Alpha particle, i.e. a positively charged particle made up of two protons and two neutrons.

ʻAle·pania iʻoa Albania; Albanian. Dic. Also ʻAlabania.

ʻale·ʻale See hawewe ʻaleʻale.

ʻAle·geria iʻoa Algeria; Algerian. Dic., sp. var. Also ʻAlekelia.

ʻali ham To dig (the ball), in volleyball. Dic., ext. mng. See ʻali ʻūlau. Mea ʻali. Digger. Also ʻali. ʻAli ʻūlau. Pancake dig.

ʻali·upa ham Alley-oop, a basketball play. E kakali wale ana ʻo Loa i ke kīloi ʻia mai i hiki ai iā ia ke ʻaliupa. Loa was just waiting to be passed the ball so that he could make the alley-oop play. Eng.

ʻalihi See ʻalihikūlele.

ʻalihi·kū·lele kik Quarterback, in football. Sh. ʻalihikaua + kūlele. Also ʻalihi.

ʻĀ·lika iʻoa Arctic. Dic.

ʻā·like ʻaʻ Identical, matching. Dic. Nā hapa ʻālike. Identical parts. Mana ʻālike. Concurrent power, as powers shared by federal and state governments.

ʻā·like·like kik/ʻaʻ Symmetry; symmetric, symmetrical, in math. Redup. of ʻālike. Kaha ʻālikelike. Line of symmetry, a line on which a figure can be folded so the two parts fit exactly, in math. Kinona ʻālikelike. Symmetric figure. ʻĀlikelike aka. Reflection symmetry. ʻĀlikelike kau. Translation symmetry. ʻĀlikelike wili. Rotational symmetry.

ʻali·koka kik Artichoke. Eng.

ʻAli·kona iʻoa Arizona; Arizonan, Arizonian. Dic. Also ʻArizona.

ʻā·lina kik Scar (preceded by ke). Dic. Also ninanina.

ʻali·dirina kik Aldrin, a kind of insecticide. Eng. Cf. dielidirina. See lāʻau make.

ʻalo hoʻo·piʻi ʻelua ham Double jeopardy, i.e. to be tried in court twice for the same offense. Lit., endure two court cases.

ʻalo·kio kik Private land. Dic., ext. mng. Also ʻalodio. Cf. ʻāina no ka lehulehu.

ʻalo·peke ʻA·lika kik Arctic fox. Also ʻalopeka ʻĀlika.

ʻaloʻa·hia kik Emotional stress. Mān. (MMLH).

ʻalo·dio kik Private land. Dic., ext. mng., sp. var. Also ʻalokio. Cf. ʻāina no ka lehulehu.

ʻalu ʻaʻ Lax, as articulation, in linguistics. Dic., ext. mng. Cf. mālō. Woela ʻalu. Lax vowel.

ʻā·lua·lua Papa ʻālualua. Multiplication tables. Comb. papa + dic. See ʻālualua (dic.).

ʻalumi·numa kik Aluminum. Eng.

ʻā·luna See palena ʻāluna o ka hewa.

ʻalu·ʻalu kik Bark, of a plant; skin. Niʻihau. Also ʻili.

ʻama·kila kik Armadillo. Eng.

ʻā·mana Kuʻi ʻāmana. To bump (the ball), in volleyball.

ʻā·mana koho kik Dichotomous key. Lit., Y-shaped branch (for) choosing.

ʻā·mana·puʻu kik Bronchus, bronchiole; bronchial. Comb. ʻāmana + puʻu. ʻĀmanapuʻu kuamua. Primary bronchus. ʻĀmanapuʻu kualua. Secondary bronchus, lobar bronchus. Āmanapuʻu kuakolu. Tertiary bronchus, segmental bronchus. ʻĀmanapuʻu kuahope. Terminal bronchiole.

 

ʻā·maʻa·mau heh In rapid succession. Dic.

ʻAma·sona iʻoa Amazon. Eng. Ka muliwai ʻo ʻAmasona. Amazon river.

ʻAme·lika iʻoa America; American. Dic. See entries below.

ʻAme·lika Hema iʻoa South America; South American. Dic.

ʻAme·lika Hui Pū ʻia iʻoa United States of America; American. Dic., sp. var.

ʻAme·lika Waena iʻoa Central America, Latin America; Central American, Latin American. Dic.

ʻAme·lika ʻĀ·kau iʻoa North America; North American. Dic.

ʻĀ·mē·nia iʻoa Armenia. Eng.

ʻami kik Hinge. Dic. ʻAmi puka. Door hinge. Also ʻami ʻīpuka.

ʻamino kik Amino. Eng. ʻAkika ʻamino. Amino acid,

ʻamo See iwi kuʻe ʻamo. Mākala ʻamo. Sphincter, i.e. an annular muscle surrounding and able to contract or close a bodily opening or channel. Puka ʻamo. Anus, i.e. the posterior opening of the alimentary canal. Also puka kahiko.

ʻamo·nia kik Ammonia. Eng.

ʻamoni·uma kik Ammonium. Eng. ʻAmoniuma molaibadahate. Ammonium molybdate.

ʻā·mui kik Assembly, i.e. a gathering of people for a specific purpose. Tah.

ʻan Abbreviation for ʻauneki (ounce).

ʻana Iwi ʻana. Cancellous bone.

ʻā·nai ham To rub, as one's eyes. Niʻihau. Cf. ʻanaʻanai. See entry below.

ʻā·nai Haku ʻānai. Neolithic, in anthropology. Ke au haku ʻānai. Neolithie age, period.

ʻana·hai·dara·side kik Anhydride, i.e. a compound formed from another by the removal of water. Eng. Cf. nele wai. ʻAnahaidaraside kuapapa. Basic anhydride, a metallic oxide that forms a base when added to water. ʻAnahaidara-side ʻakika. Acidic anhydride.

ʻAna·heu·heu iʻoa Corona Borealis, a constellation. Tah.

ʻana·kio·pua kik Angiosperm. Comb. angio (Gr.) + pua.

ʻAna·kola iʻoa Andorra. Eng.

ʻAna·kolo·meka iʻoa Andromeda. Eng. Ka wiliau hōkū ʻo ʻAnakolomeka. Andromeda galaxy.

ʻAna·muli iʻoa Alderamin, a star. (Tah. ʻAnamuri.)

ʻana·naka kik Jackfruit. (Ilocano ananka.)

ʻana·nuʻu ʻaʻ Deflated, as a balloon. Dic., ext. mng. Also puhalu (dic.), emi (Niʻihau). Cf. pakiʻi. See hoʻopūhalalū.

ʻana·puʻu kik Lymph. Mān. Lōkuʻu ʻanapuʻu. Lymph gland, lymph node. Maʻi ʻaʻai ʻanapuʻu, Lymphoma.

ʻana·ʻanai ham To rub repeatedly, as one's eyes. Niʻihau. Cf. ʻānai.

ʻAna·damana iʻoa Andaman. Eng. Ke kai ʻo ʻAnadamana. Andaman Sea.

ʻAna·gola iʻoa Angola; Angolan. Eng.

-ʻāne Huaʻāne. Spermatozoon, sperm, in biology. Cf. huaʻine.

ʻāne ʻaʻ Positive, as of electrical charge or north pole of a magnet. Inv. See hohoki, ʻine, ʻūholo uila ʻāne. Huna ʻāne. Proton.

ʻane hala·pohe ʻaʻ Endangered. Lit., almost extinct. Also ʻane make loa, ʻane nalowale loa. Kānāwai Lāhulu ʻAne Halapohe. Endangered Species Act.

ʻane make loa ʻaʻ Endangered. Lit., almost extinct. Also ʻane halapohe, ʻane nalowale loa.

ʻane nalo·wale loa ʻaʻ Endangered. Lit., almost extinct. Also ʻane halapohe, ʻane make loa.

ʻAne·ʻā·lika iʻoa Antarctica; Antarctic. Dic., sp. var.

 

ʻanini kik Eaves (preceded by ke). Dic., ext. mng.

ʻanini lau·lā hawewe kik Amplitude modulation. Lit., amplitude variation. Also AM (pronounced ʻāmū). Cf. FM.

ʻano like ʻaʻ Similar, in math. Lit., somewhat alike. Kinona ʻano like. Similar figure.

ʻano·pili kik Property, i.e. distinctive attribute, as of a number, in math (preceded by ke). Dic., sp. var. See entries below.

ʻano·pili o ka ʻē·koʻa kik Opposites property, in math (preceded by ke). Lit., property of the opposite.

ʻano·pili helu kik Number property, in math (preceded by ke).

ʻano·pili hoʻi hope See ʻanopili kaʻina hoʻi hope.

ʻano·pili hoʻo·ili kik Distributive property, in math (preceded by ke). Lit., transferring property. Cf. ʻanopili kaʻina hoʻi hope.

ʻano·pili hoʻo·like kik Associative property, in math (preceded by ke). Lit., equalizing property.

ʻano·pili hoʻo·pū·ʻulu kik Grouping property, in math (preceded by ke).

ʻano·pili kau·like kik Equality property, in math (preceded by ke).

ʻano·pili kaʻina hoʻi hope kik Commutative property, in math (preceded by ke). Lit., property (with) order reversed. Also ʻanopili hoʻi hope. Cf. ʻanopili hoʻoili.

ʻano·pili kemi·kala kik Chemical property (preceded by ke).

ʻano·pili ʻekahi kik One property, in multiplication (preceded by ke).

ʻano·pili ʻole kik Zero property (preceded by ke). ʻAnopili ʻole o ka hoʻonui. Zero property of multiplication.

ʻano·ʻano kik Seed. Dic. Wahī ʻanoʻano. Seed pod.

ʻanuʻu kik Stair, step. Dic. See entry below. Papa ʻanuʻu lalo kai. Underwater terrace.

ʻanuʻu hana kik Step, as in problem solving. Dic., ext. mng. Also ʻanuʻu.

ʻan w Abbreviation for ʻauneki wai (fluid ounce).

ʻAp. Abbreviation for ʻApelila (April).

ʻā·pahu·pahu ham To repel, as like charges in a magnet. Comb. ʻā- + pahupahu. See entry below.

ʻā·pahu·pahu ʻaʻ Faded, as material which has been left in the sun. Niʻihau.

ʻā·pā lole kik Bolt of material. Dic. See ʻīālole.

ʻā·pana Makaʻāinana ʻāpana. Constituent, i.e. a voter in a district who is represented by an elected official.

ʻā·pana hana kik Errand. Trad. Also hana.

ʻā·pana hapa·hā kik Quadrant. Lit., quarter piece. Cf. ʻāpana noiʻi.

ʻā·pana kaha kik Line segment, in math.

ʻā·pana·kahi kik Increment, i.e. one of a series of additions in groups or quantity. Comb. ʻāpana + kahi.

ʻā·pana noiʻi kik Quadrat, i.e. a rectangular plot used for ecological or population studies. Lit., research section. Cf. ʻāpana hapahā.

ʻā·pana·pana Moena ʻili ʻāpanapana. Floor tile. Also kile ʻili, kile papahele.

ʻā·pana pā·ʻoi·hana kau·waena kik Central business district. Cf. kaona.

ʻā·pana ʻaha·ʻō·lelo lā·hui kik Congressional district, in government. Ua hoʻi aku nei ke Kenekoa i kōna ʻāpana ʻahaʻōlelo lāhui ponoʻī e hōʻike ai no nā kānāwai i puka. The Senator returned to his congressional district to report about the laws that had passed.

ʻā·papapa kik Reef. Niʻihau. Ula ʻāpapapa, Slipper lobster. Also ula pāpapa. See ʻōmā.

 

ʻā·paʻa·kuma ʻaʻ Endemic. Dic., ext. mng. Cf. ʻōiwi. Meakanu ʻāpaʻakuma. Endemic plant.

ʻApe·kani·kana iʻoa Afghanistan; Afghan, Afghani. Dic. Also ʻAfekanisana.

ʻApe·lika iʻoa Africa; African. Dic. Also ʻAferika. Lepupalika ʻApelika Waena. Central African Republic. Līlia ʻApelika. Amaryllis. ʻApelika Hema. South Africa; South African.

ʻApe·lila iʻoa April. Dic. Abb. ʻAp.

ʻā·pika·pika Halo ʻāpikapika. Suction cup fin, as beneath the stomach of an ʻoʻopu.

ʻapo ham To catch, as a ball; to receive or reception, in football. Ua ʻapo kōna hoa kime i ke kinipōpō, a holo akula i ke kī pai. His teammate caught the ball and went in for a layup. Dic., ext. mng. See lawena, ʻapo lilo.

ʻā·pō ham To rebound, in basketball. He 45 ʻai a me 8 ʻāpō a Karl Malone. Karl Malone has 45 points and 8 rebounds. Var. of ʻapo.

ʻā·poho ʻāina kik Geologic depression, as Death Valley. Comb. ʻāpoho (dic., ext. mng.) + ʻāina.

ʻā·pohu kik Fullback, in football. Comb. ʻā- + pohu (var. of pahu).

ʻapo kani kā·kau kik Phonics. Lit., catch written sounds.

ʻapo kele·pona kik Telephone receiver. Lit., telephone grasp.

ʻapo lilo ham To intercept (the ball), in football. Lit., take-possession catch.

ʻapo·manaʻo heh Comprehension; to comprehend. Lit., grasp meaning. Nīnau ʻapomanaʻo. Comprehension question.

ʻā·pona kik A take, i.e. a successful shot in movie or video production. He ʻāpona! It's a take! Dic., ext. mng. See paʻi.

ʻā·pono ham To ratify, as a legislative bill or a treaty. Ua ʻāpono ʻia ka pila ma ka ʻAhaʻōlelo Lāhui. The bill was ratified in Congress. Dic., ext. mng. Ka ʻāpono ʻana. Ratification.

ʻā·pō·pō kik Tomorrow. Dic., sp. var.

ʻā·poʻe kik Camp, i.e. a gathering of people to learn or practice certain skills. Sh. ʻāpoʻepoʻe. See hoʻomoana. ʻĀpoʻe kamepiula. Computer camp. ʻĀpoʻe pōhīnaʻi. Basketball camp.

ʻā·poʻo poho pepa kik Paper tray slot, as for a computer printer. Lit., paper-tray hole (Tah.). See poho pepa, poho pākuʻi.

ʻā·puʻu See ʻāpuʻupuʻu.

ʻā·puʻu·puʻu Kaʻa holo ʻāpuʻupuʻu. Any off-road vehicle, e.g. ATV, dirt bike, 4x4, etc. Also kaʻa ʻāpuʻu.

ʻawa·hia ʻaʻ Toxic. Dic., ext. mng.

ʻawa·keke kik Gingerbread. Sh. ʻawapuhi + malakeke.

ʻā·waʻa kik Safety, in football. Dic., new mng. See lala, muku. ʻĀwaʻa lala. Weak safety. ʻĀwaʻa muku. Strong safety.

ʻawe kik Backpack, knapsack. Dic. Also pāiki hāʻawe, pāisi hāʻawe.

ʻawe·hā kik Hemoglobin. Comb. ʻawe + hā; Māori kawehā.

ʻawe·like kik Average; mean, in math. Eng. ʻAwelike o ka ua. Average rainfall. ʻAwelike māmā holo. Average speed. ʻAwelike nuipaʻa ʻātoma. Average atomic mass.

ʻawe·ʻawe kik Tentacle. Dic.

ʻā·weʻa·weʻa ʻaʻ Trace, small amount. Dic. Kumumea ʻāweʻaweʻa. Trace element.

ʻaʻai Maʻi ʻaʻai ʻanapuʻu. Lymphoma.

ʻaʻaia·ani·lā ʻaʻ Weathered; weathering. Lit., eroded by weather.

ʻaʻaia·nalu ʻaʻ Eroded or cut by waves, as a cliff. Lit., eroded by surf. Pali ʻaʻaianalu. Wave-cut cliff.

 

ʻaʻaia·wā heh/ʻaʻ Erosion; to erode; eroded. Lit., eroded (by) time.

ʻaʻahu kik Clothing. Dic. Nā ʻaʻahu hana keaka. Wardrobe, as stage costumes for a play, movie or video production. Usu. nā ʻaʻahu.

ʻaʻa kā·nā·wai ham Civil disobedience, i.e. breaking a law because it goes against personal morals. Ua kaulana ʻo Martin Luther King no kōna aʻo ʻana i ka ʻaʻa kānāwai ʻana me ka hakakā ʻole. Martin Luther King was famous for his teaching of non-violent civil disobedience. Lit., defy law.

ʻaʻalo ham To resist, as water on corrosive things. Dic., ext. mng, Uaki ʻaʻalo wai. Water-resistant watch. Also uāki ʻaʻalo wai. ʻAila ʻaʻalo paʻahau. Antifreeze. ʻAʻalo pili. Teflon. ʻAʻalo wai. Waterproof, water-resistant.

ʻaʻa·nahoa kik Adventure, as a story or movie. Comb. ʻaʻa + nahoa.

ʻaʻape·hihi kik Pothos. Redup. of ʻape + hihi. ʻAʻapehihi lau liʻi. Philodendron.

ʻā·ʻapo kik Flanker, in football. Comb. ʻā- + ʻapo.

ʻaʻapu Pepeiao ʻaʻapu. Semilunar valve, of the heart.

ʻaʻaʻa huna·ola kik Tissue, as structural material of a plant or animal. Lit., cell tissue. ʻAʻaʻa hunaola ʻailakele. Adipose tissue, i.e. animal tissue in which fat is stored. See haʻakupu ʻailakele, ʻailakele.

ʻaʻehi heh To cross, as a street. Comb. ʻAʻe + -hi (transitive ending). See ʻaʻehina.

ʻaʻe·hina kik Crosswalk. Comb. ʻaʻehi + -na. See ʻaʻehi. Kukui ʻaʻehina. Crosswalk light.

ʻaʻe kā·nā·wai ham To break the law. Dic. Also haʻihaʻi kānāwai. Cf. pale kānāwai.

ʻaʻena kik Violation, as in basketball. ʻO ke kake iki akula nō ia o Niu, a hoʻōho maila ka ʻuao i ka ʻaʻena ʻekolu kekona. Niu just shifted a little, and the official called him on the three-second violation. Comb. ʻaʻe + -na. See entry below. ʻAʻena laina kūwaena. Backcourt violation. ʻAʻena ʻekolu kekona. Three-second violation. ʻAʻena ʻumi kekona. Ten-second violation.

ʻaʻena kik Violation, as in volleyball. Comb. ʻaʻe + -na. ʻAʻena hāpai. Carrying violation. ʻAʻena kukuna. Antenna violation. ʻAʻena paʻi ulele. Service violation. ʻAʻena paʻi lua. Double-hit violation. ʻAʻena ʻekolu mika. Three-meter line violation. See laina ʻekolu mika. ʻAʻena ʻumi kapuaʻi. Ten-foot line violation. See laina ʻumi kapuaʻi. ʻAʻena ʻupena. Net violation.

ʻaʻe palena ham To go out of bounds, in sports. Lit., trespass (a) boundary.

ʻā·ʻī kik Collar. Mān. Also ʻāʻī lole, ʻāʻī kala, kala. Aʻa kino ʻāʻī. Jugular vein. Aʻa puʻuwai ʻāʻī. Carotid artery. Hoʻomālō ʻāʻī. Neek stretches, i.e. a warm-up exercise for sports such as volleyball; also to do this exercise.

ʻā·ʻiwa kik Defensive corner back, in football. Comb. ʻā- + ʻiwa.

ʻaʻohe launa ʻaʻ Inappropriate. Niʻihau.

ʻaʻole i pau "Stay tuned," "to be continued," as during a TV program. Lit., not finished.

ʻAfe·kani·sana iʻoa Afghanistan; Afghan, Afghani. Eng. Also ʻApekanikana.

ʻAfe·rika iʻoa Africa; African. Dic., sp. var. Also ʻApelika. ʻAferika Hema. South Africa; South African.

ʻAra·bia iʻoa Arabia, Arabian. Eng. Also ʻAlapia. Saudi ʻArabia. Saudi Arabia; Saudi. Also Saudi ʻAlapia.

ʻara·gona kik Argon, an element. Eng.

 

ʻAri·zona iʻoa Arizona; Arizonan, Arizonian. Dic., sp. var. Also ʻAlikona.

ʻasete·line kik Acetylene. Eng.

ʻĀ·sia iʻoa Asia; Asian, Asiatic. Dic., sp. var. Also ʻĀkia.

ʻAte·lanika iʻoa Atlantic. Dic., sp. var. Also ʻAkelanika.

ʻā·toma kik Atom, atomic. Eng. Lou ʻātoma. Bond between atoms or ions as a result of gaining, losing, or sharing electrons.

ʻea kik Melody, tune. Eng. (air). Also leo. See entries below and mū hōlapu pale ʻea pau, ʻōnaehana pale ʻea, ʻukulele ʻea honu.

ʻea kik Plastic. Niʻihau. Kanaka ʻea. Mannequin. ʻEke ʻea. Plastic bag (preceded by ke). Cf. pūʻolo pepa. Tuko paipu ʻea. Plastic pipe cement. Also tuko paipu.

ʻea kau lole kik Hanger, when made of plastic. Lit., plastic (for) placing clothes. See uea kau lole, lāʻau kau lole, mea kau lole.

ʻea kāki kik Charge card. Lit., plastic (for) charging. Also kāleka kāki.

ʻea paina·ʻā·pala kik Polyethylene. Lit., pineapple plastic (from the plastic used when planting pineapples). See hāliʻi ʻea.

ʻea ʻeke·ʻeke kik Six-pack ring, i.e. the plastic ring which holds the cans together. Lit., six-pack plastic. ʻEa ʻekeʻeke koloaka. Six-pack soda ring. ʻEa ʻekeʻeke pia. Six-pack beer ring.

ʻeono ʻī·niha kik Six inches, i.e. a warm-up exercise for sports such as volleyball.

ʻEu·lā ·sia iʻoa Eurasia; Eurasian. Eng. Ka Una Honua ʻEulāeia. Eurasian Plate.

ʻEu·lopa iʻoa Europe. Dic. See entry below. ʻEulopa Hikina. Eastern Europe; Eastern European. ʻEulopa Komohana. Western Europe; Western European.

ʻEu·lopa iʻoa Europa, a moon of Jupiter. Eng.

ʻē·heu See pihi wili ʻēheu.

ʻehia How, what, as in asking about any kind of measurement. ʻEhia ka lōʻihi o kēlā pākaukau? How long is that table? Niʻihau. Also he aha.

ʻē·kā kik Agar, a gelatin-like product of certain seaweeds used as a thickening agent. Eng.

ʻē·kakaʻa heh To separate easily, as a nut from its shell. Ke pūlehu kūpono ʻoe i ka hua kukui, a i ke ʻano o kou kīkē ʻana i ka iwi, e ʻēkakaʻa wale mai nō ka ʻiʻo mai ka iwi mai. If you broil the kukui nut well, as you break open the shell, the meat will separate easily from the shell. Mān. (LKK).

ʻeke kik Bag (preceded by ke). See entries below and pūʻolo.

ʻeke ukana kik Basket, as on a bicycle (preceded by ke). Niʻihau. See ʻie.

ʻeke hia·moe kik Sleeping bag (preceded by ke). Also ʻeke moe.

ʻeke keni·keni kik Coin purse (preceded by ke). Lit., bag (for) loose change.

ʻeke mimi kik Bladder (preceded by ke). Mān.

ʻeke moe kik Sleeping bag (preceded by ke). Also ʻeke hiamoe.

ʻeke pela kik Mattress cover (preceded by ke). Lit., mattress bag.

ʻeke ʻea kik Plastic bag (preceded by ke). Cf. pūʻolo pepa.

ʻeke·ʻeke kik Six-pack, as of drinks. Niʻihau. Cf. ʻope. See pahu, pūʻolo, ʻea ʻekeʻeke. ʻEkeʻeke koloaka. Six-pack of soda. ʻEkeʻeke pia. Six-pack of beer.

ʻeki kik Ace, in volleyball. Dic., ext. mng. Also ʻai hāʻawi wale.

ʻekolu mika See laina ʻekolu mika, ʻaʻena ʻekolu mika.

ʻē·kona kik Acorn. Eng. Also hua kumu ʻoka.

 

ʻē·koʻa ʻaʻ Opposite. Sh. ʻē + ʻokoʻa. ʻĒkoʻa me. To be the opposite of. Ua ʻēkoʻa ka ʻeleʻele me ke keʻokeʻo. Black is the opposite of white.

ʻEkua·kola iʻoa Ecuador; Ecuadoran, Ecuadorean, Ecuadorian. Dic. Also ʻEkuaadora.

ʻEkua·kolia Kini ʻEkuakolia. Equatorial Guinea.

ʻEkua·dora iʻoa Ecuador; Ecuadoran, Ecuadorean, Ecuadorian. Dic. Also ʻEkuakola.

ʻekue Nuku ʻekue. King Kong finch (chloridops regiskongi). See hona, ʻainohu Kauō, ʻainohu Nīhoa.

ʻē·lau kik Crown, as on a pineapple. Dic., ext. mng. ʻĒlau hala kahiki. Pineapple crown. Also ʻēlau painaʻāpala.

ʻelala kik Insect, bug. (Wallis Futuna ngarara.) Pine ʻelala. Insect mounting; to mount insects. ʻŌmole mālama ʻelala. Insect holding jar. ʻŌmole pepehi ʻelala. Insect killing jar. ʻUpena ʻelala. Insect net. ʻUpena ʻelala hoʻolewalewa. Insect fixed net. ʻUpena ʻelala kāʻeʻe. Insect sweep net. ʻUpena ʻelala ʻeke. Insect bag net.

ʻEla Sala·vadora iʻoa El Salvador; Salvadoran, Salvadorian. Eng.

ʻele Ke Kai ʻEle. Black Sea.

ʻele·ao kik Aphid, a kind of insect. Dic. Meli ʻeleao. Honeydew, i.e. a sweet juice secreted by aphids.

ʻele·hune kik Silt. Sh. kelekele (PPN lepo) + hune.

ʻē·leka kik Moose. Dic. (elk).

ʻele·kanu kik Planting medium. Sh. kelekele (PPN lepo) + kanu. Cf. lepo kanu meakanu.

ʻelele mana·koho kik Elector, as in the United States Electoral College. Lit., voter delegate.

ʻele·lū kī·kē·kē kik American cockroach (Periplaneta americana). Dic.

ʻele·lū laʻa·loa kik German cockroach (Blattella germanica). Comb. ʻelelū + dic.

ʻele·lū Nū·hō·lani kik Australian cockroach (Periplaneta australasiae).

ʻele·makua kik Loam. Sh. kelekele (PPN lepo) + onematua (Māori, loam).

ʻele·muku Koʻe ʻelemuku. Nematode.

ʻele·nahu kik Peat. Sh. kelekele (PPN lepo) + nanahu.

ʻele·pani o ke kai kik Walrus. Lit., elephant of the sea. Also palaʻo.

ʻele·pani pū·hulu·hulu kik Woolly mammoth. Lit., hairy elephant.

ʻele·peli Pīʻai ʻelepeli. Elderberry.

ʻele·popo kik Humus. Sh. kelekele (PPN lepo) + popopo.

ʻEli·kilea iʻoa Eritrea. Eng.

ʻelima Nā Hui Nui ʻElima. The Big Five, i.e. the five corporations that controlled most of the sugar industry in Hawaiʻi.

ʻelua Kūlana ʻelua. Runner-up, second place.

ʻelua hale kik Bicameral, as a legislature. ʻElua hale o ka ʻahaʻōlelo. The legislature is bicameral. Lit., two houses. Cf. aupuni ʻaoʻao ʻelua.

ʻelua ʻao·ʻao like Isosceles. Lit., two equal sides. Huinakolu ʻelua ʻaoʻao like. Isosceles triangle.

ʻeme·pela Aupuni ʻemepela. Empire. Ka pae mauna kai ʻo ʻEmepela. Emperor Seamounts.

ʻemila kik Emir. Dic. Also ʻemira. Aupuni ʻemila. Emirate. Also aupuni ʻemira. ʻEmira ʻAlapia Hui Pū ʻia. United Arab Emirates.

ʻemira See ʻemila.

ʻena makani kik Gale, stormy wind; whole trees in motion and inconvenienee felt in walking against the wind, in meteorology. Dic., ext. mng. See makani.

 

ʻene·hana kik Technology. Sh. ʻenekini + mea hana. Cf. ʻoiʻenehana. Mea ʻenehana. Technician. Luna ʻenehana. Production engineer, as for movie or video production. Hope luna ʻenehana. Assistant production engineer. Manakia ʻenehana. Production manager. Mea ʻenehana kani. Sound technician. Mea ʻenehana kiʻi. Graphics technician.

ʻEne·kela·kuke iʻoa Enceladus, a small moon of Saturn. Eng.

ʻene·kini Pani ʻenekini. Hood, as of a car or truck.

ʻene·kinia kik Engineer. Dic. ʻEne-kinia mīkini. Mechanical engineer.

ʻene·kini kī·kaha kik Maneuvering engine, as for a spacecraft.

ʻEne·lani iʻoa England, English person; English (of England). Dic. Also Pelekāne. Cf. Pelekānia.

ʻenuhe hamu·iʻa kik Carnivorous caterpillar (Eupithecia spp).

ʻenuhe hele pō kik Cutworm. Lit., caterpillar (that) goes (at) night. Also poko.

ʻepa ham To fake out, in basketball. ʻEpa aku nei ʻo ia ma ka ʻākau, ka hema; kaha ihola ʻo ia ma waena o nā kūpale ʻelua. He faked to the right, the left; he made the drive right through the two defenders. Lit., deceive. See pākī ʻepa.

ʻepaki kik Phase. Mān. (HKM)/Eng. ʻEpaki mahina. Phase of the moon (Western concept).

ʻepane kik Apron. Dic. Also pale kuene.

ʻepe·kema kik Science. (Greek epetema.) Also akeakamai. Kauhelu ʻepekema. Scientific notation. Kanaka noiʻi ʻepekema. Scientific researcher.

ʻepe·soma kik Epsom. Eng. Paʻakai ʻepesoma. Epsom salt.

ʻEwa Kulanui Kaiaulu o ʻEwa. Leeward Community College.

ʻewa·ʻewa Puʻuwai pana ʻewaʻewa. Cardiac arrythmia.

ʻEwe·leka iʻoa Everest. Eng. Mauna ʻEweleka. Mount Everest.

ʻeʻe heh To log on, log in, as of a network or other computer system. Dic., new mng. Cf. lele.

ʻeʻele ʻaʻ Concave, i.e. hollowed or rounded inward, as the inside of a bowl. Sh./redup. of kaʻele. Cf. ʻeʻemu. Aniani ʻeʻele. Concave mirror. Aniani kaulona ʻeʻele. Concave lens.

ʻeʻemu ʻaʻ Convex, i.e. curved or rounded, as the exterior of a sphere or circle. Sh./redup. of lemu. Cf. ʻeʻele. Aniani ʻeʻemu. Convex mirror. Aniani kaulona ʻeʻemu. Convex lens.

ʻeʻepa pau·ʻaka kik Goblin. Lit., grotesque person with miraculous powers.

ʻEse·tonia iʻoa Estonia. Eng.

ʻeto kik Ethyl. Eng. ʻĀkeka ʻeto. Ethyl acetate.

ʻI Abbreviation for ʻili (area).

ʻī·ā kik Yard, a unit of measurement. Eng. No abbreviation. ʻĪā paʻaʻiliono. Cublic yard.

ʻī·ā·lole kik Material, cloth. Mān. (MMLH, HHLH). See ʻāpā lole.

ʻie kik Basket (preceded by ke). Dic. See ʻeke ukana.

ʻloa iʻoa Iowa; Iowan. Dic., sp. var. Also ʻAioā.

ʻio·kine kik Iodine. Eng. See hōʻiokine.

ʻiole kik Mouse, as for a computer. Dic., ext. mng. See nahau ʻiole.

ʻiole kik Mouse, rat. Dic. See entries below. ʻIole kaupoku. Roof rat. ʻIole kia. Deer mouse. ʻIole wāwae kea. White-footed mouse.

ʻiole kawia kik Guinea pig. Comb. ʻiole + cavia (Latin).

ʻiole kepila kik Gerbil. Comb. ʻiole + Eng. Also ʻiole kebira.

ʻiole lā·piki kik Rabbit. Niʻihau. Also lāpiki, lāpaki. See entries under lāpaki.

 

ʻiona kik Ion.

ʻio·ʻio Pene ʻioʻio. Brooder.

ʻiodi·side kik Iodide. Eng. Potasiuma ʻiodiside. Potassium iodide.

ʻIka·hō iʻoa Idaho; Idahoan. Dic.

ʻĪ·kā·lia iʻoa Italy; Italian. Dic., sp. var. Also ʻĪtālia.

ʻikamu kik Entry, item, object. E koho i kekahi o nā ʻikamu i hōʻike ʻia. Choose one of the given objects. Dic., ext. mng. Ma ka ʻikamu. À la carte, as on a menu. Also ʻoka pākahikahi.

ʻike kik Information. Dic., ext. mng. See entries below and poʻo pāʻālua.

ʻike Laina ʻike. Line of sight, sight line. Also laina lena.

ʻike hā·nau See lawena.

ʻike kuʻuna kik Traditional knowledge. Aʻo kahua ʻike kuʻuna. Traditional knowledge-based learning.

ʻike·pili kik Data. Lit., associated information. See entry below and ili, kāhuakomo, kāhuapuka, kākuhi, waiho. Hōkeo ʻikepili. Data bank, database. Hoʻokuene ʻikepili. To browse, as in a database program having the capability to rearrange data, Laina ʻikepili. Data stream, as in a computer program. Pakuhi huina ʻikepili. Cross-tab graph, in math. Pukaaniani kolamu ʻikepili. List editor screen, in a computer program.

ʻike·pili helu kik Statistics, i.e. numerical facts or data, in math. Lit., number data.

ʻī·koi honua kik Earth's core. Dic., ext. mng.

ʻī·komo kik Filling, as for a sandwich. Comb. ʻī- (Tah.) + komo. Cf. ʻīpiha.

ʻiku·ana kik Iguana. Eng.

ʻIlaka iʻoa Iraq; Iraqi. Dic. Also ʻIraka.

ʻIlana iʻoa Iran; Iranian. Dic. Also ʻIrana.

ʻileika kik Eraser. Eng. Also mea holoi, pale holoi.

ʻIle·lani iʻoa Ireland; Irish. Dic. Also ʻIrelani. See ʻAiliki.

ʻili kik Skin. Dic. Also ʻaluʻalu. See entries below and moena ʻili. Welu ʻili. Chamois, chamois cloth. ʻIli kūloko. Subcutus, in biology. ʻIli kūwaena. Dermis. ʻIli kūwaho. Epidermis. ʻŌnaehana ʻili. Integumentary system, in biology.

ʻili kik Bark, of a plant. Dic. Also ʻaluʻalu. Wale ʻili. Cambium, i.e. the slippery layer under the bark of a plant which is the growing area of the stem. ʻIli iho. Inner bark. ʻIli o waho. Outer bark.

ʻili Paihaʻakei ʻili. Racism, i.e. adhering to a belief that one's own race is superior to another race. Also paihaʻakei lāhui.

ʻili alo kik Surface area, in math. Comb. ʻili + alo. Also ʻili.

ʻī·lio ʻAu ʻīlio. Dog paddle, in swimming; to dog paddle. Lit., swim (like a) dog.

ʻī·lio kē·lia kik Terrier. (Latin terrarius.) Also kēlia.

ʻIli·oki iʻoa Pluto, the planet. Inv.

ʻili hoʻo·lohe puʻu·wai kik Stethoscope. Lit., tube (for) listening (to the) heart. Also kiupe hoʻolohe.

ʻili·kai kik Sea level. Dic., ext. mng. Cf. ʻiliwai.

ʻili kalapu wā·wae kik Jess, a leg strap for falcons. Lit., leg strap.

ʻIli·kini See waʻa ʻIlikini, ʻĪnia.

ʻili kuapo Apo ʻili kuapo. Belt loop, as on a pair of pants.

ʻili lau·lā kik Area, a quantitative measurement. ʻEhia ka ʻili laulā o kēia huinakolu? What is the area of this triangle? Lit., surface width and breadth. Also ʻili. Abb. ʻI.

ʻili·lahi Papa ʻililahi. Plywood. Cf. papawai.

ʻIli·noe iʻoa Illinois; Illinoisan. Dic.

ʻili·wai kik Carpenter's level. Dic. Cf. ʻilikai.

 

ʻili·wehi kik Veneer. Comb. ʻili + wehi.

ʻili·ʻili kik Cobble. Dic., ext. mng.

ʻī·maka kik Lookout, scenic view-point. Dic.

ʻimi hā·ʻina ham To solve a problem, look for a solution. E ʻimi ʻoe i ka hāʻina o ka polopolema helu ʻekolu. Solve problem three. Cf. hoʻoponopono pilikia, huli hāʻina.

ʻīn Abbreviation for ʻīniha (inch).

ʻī·nana See lau ʻīnana.

ʻinā·ʻinā ʻaʻ Hypothetical. Redup./var. of inā.

-ʻine Huaʻine. Ovum, in biology. Cf. huaʻāne.

ʻine ʻaʻ Negative, as of an electrical charge or south pole of a magnet. Inv. See hohoki, ʻāne, ʻūholo uila ʻine. Huna ʻine. Electron.

ʻĪ·nia iʻoa India; Indian, i.e. referring to India and its peoples. Dic. Cf. ʻIniana.

ʻIni·ana Moana ʻIniana. Indian Ocean. Dic. Cf.ʻĪnia.

ʻĪ·nio- Indo-. Sh. ʻĪnia + o. See entry below.

ʻĪ·nio·nū·hō·lani iʻoa Indo-Australian. Comb. ʻĪnio- + Nūhōlani. Ka Una Honua ʻĪnionūhōlani. Indo-Australian Plate.

ʻī·niha kik Inch. Dic. Abb. ʻīn.

ʻIni·kiana iʻoa Indiana; Indianian. Dic. Also ʻInidiana.

ʻinik·ō See manu ʻinikō.

ʻini·kua kik Insurance. Dic. Uku ʻinikua. Insurance premium. ʻInikua olakino. Medical insurance. Helu ʻinikua olakino. Medical coverage number.

ʻIni·diana iʻoa Indiana; Indianian. Dic., sp. var. Also ʻInikiana.

ʻIni·done·sia iʻoa Indonesia; Indonesian. Eng.

ʻInu·ika kik Eskimo person, language, or culture. Usu. ʻInuiia. Inuit.

ʻInu·ita See ʻInuika.

ʻī·pale kik Insulation. Comb. ʻī- + pale. See hōʻīpale.

ʻī·piha kik Filling, as of a tooth. Comb. ʻī- (Tah.) + piha. Cf. ʻīkomo.

ʻī·piki Manu ʻīpiki. Ibis, a flightless bird in prehistoric Hawaiʻi.

ʻī·puka kik Alias or gateway, as in a computer program. Dic., ext. mng.

ʻī·puka uai kik Sliding door. Also puka uai.

ʻī·puka pakele pahū kik Explosive escape hatch, as in a spaceship. Lit., explosive escape door.

ʻIwa·keliʻi iʻoa Cassiopeia, a constellation. Mān. (HA).

ʻiwa·ʻiwa kik Maidenhair fern. Dic.

ʻiʻo See helu ʻiʻo, helu ʻiʻo ʻole, helu piha, waiwai ʻiʻo, ʻiʻo ʻole.

ʻiʻo wili·wili kik Meat meal. Lit., ground meat. Cf. iwi wiliwili.

ʻiʻo ʻole Kaha ʻiʻo ʻole. Negative sign, in math (-). Cf. kaha hoʻolawe.

ʻIraka iʻoa Iraq; Iraqi. Dic., sp. var. Also ʻIlaka.

ʻIrana iʻoa Iran; Iranian. Dic., sp. var. Also ʻIlana.
